newsitem.title: CHINA: China electronics exports seen at $35 bln by 2000.
newsitem.headline: China electronics exports seen at $35 bln by 2000.

text.p: China's electronics industry is forecast to export $35 billion worth of goods in the year 2000, the International Business Daily said on Thursday.
The figure was $18.4 billion in 1996, up 15 percent from 1995, the newspaper said, quoting unidentified sources.
The output value of electronics products was forecast to total 700 billion yuan ($84.3 billion) in 2000, it said.
Exports by China's 600 foreign-funded enterprises accounted for 34 percent of total electronics exports in 1996, the newspaper said.
Electronics exports made up 38 percent of China's total exports, the daily said.
China's electronics industry has attracted foreign investment totalling about $7.0 billion, the newspaper said. It gave no further details.
